titleStmt.title: A discourse vpon the meanes of vvel governing and maintaining in good peace, a kingdome, or other principalitie Divided into three parts, namely, the counsell, the religion, and the policie, vvhich a prince ought to hold and follow. Against Nicholas Machiavell the Florentine. Translated into English by Simon Patericke.
Discours, sur les moyens de bien gouverner et maintenir en bonne paix un royaume ou autre principauté. English
titleStmt.author: Gentillet, Innocent, ca. 1535-ca. 1595.

titleStmt.title: A discourse vpon the meanes of vvel governing and maintaining in good peace, a kingdome, or other principalitie Divided into three parts, namely, the counsell, the religion, and the policie, vvhich a prince ought to hold and follow. Against Nicholas Machiavell the Florentine. Translated into English by Simon Patericke.
Discours, sur les moyens de bien gouverner et maintenir en bonne paix un royaume ou autre principauté. English
titleStmt.author: Gentillet, Innocent, ca. 1535-ca. 1595.
Patrick, Simon, d. 1613.

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Gentillet, Innocent. Discours, sur les moyens de bien gouverner et maintenir en bonne paix un royaume ou autre principauté.
A reply to: Machiavelli, Niccolò. Il principe.
First two words of title are xylographic.
With two final leaves bearing "A table of the maximes"; the last leaf is blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
